content:
Annotation Class

In this Article

Represents a user annotation in the Microsoft Annotations Framework.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Xml.Serialization.XmlRoot(ElementName="Annotation", Namespace="http://schemas.microsoft.com/windows/annotations/2003/11/core")]
public sealed class Annotation : System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • Annotation

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Annotation represents a single annotation with all associated anchoring and content data. An annotation consists of the following main elements.

  • Zero, one, or more Anchors that identify what is being annotated.

  • Zero, one, or more Cargos that contain the user data for the annotation.

  • Zero, one, or more Authors that define who created the annotation.

  • A CreationTime that specifies the date and time when the annotation was created.

  • A LastModificationTime that specifies when the annotation was last updated.

  • A unique annotation Id (a globally unique identifier (GUID)).

Constructors summary

Annotation()

This constructor supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Annotation(XmlQualifiedName)

Initializes a new instance of the Annotation class that has a specified type name and namespace.
Annotation(XmlQualifiedName,Guid,DateTime,DateTime)

This constructor supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Properties summary

Anchors

Gets a collection of zero or more AnnotationResource anchor elements that define the data selection(s) being annotated.
AnnotationType

Gets the XmlQualifiedName of the annotation type.
Authors

Gets a collection of zero or more author strings that identify who created the Annotation.
Cargos

Gets a collection of zero or more AnnotationResource cargo elements that contain data for the annotation.
CreationTime

Gets the date and the time that the annotation was created.
Id

Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the Annotation.
LastModificationTime

Gets the date and the time that the annotation was last modified.

Methods summary

GetSchema()

Always returns null. See Annotations Schema for schema details.
ReadXml(XmlReader)

Deserializes the Annotation from a specified XmlReader.
WriteXml(XmlWriter)

Serializes the annotation to a specified XmlWriter.

Events summary

AnchorChanged

Occurs when an anchor is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation stem.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors*.
AuthorChanged

Occurs when an author is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation stem.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Authors*.
CargoChanged

Occurs when a cargo is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation stem.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos*.

Constructors

  • Annotation()

    This constructor supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    public Annotation ();

    Remarks

    Note

    Applications should not use the default constructor without parameters–the default constructor does not fully initialize the instance. To create a new Annotation applications should use one of the parameter-based constructors.

  • Annotation(XmlQualifiedName)

    Initializes a new instance of the Annotation class that has a specified type name and namespace.

    public Annotation (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName annotationType);

    Parameters

    • annotationType
      XmlQualifiedName

      The type name of the annotation.

  • Annotation(XmlQualifiedName,Guid,DateTime,DateTime)

    This constructor supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    public Annotation (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName annotationType, Guid id, DateTime creationTime, DateTime lastModificationTime);

    Parameters

    • annotationType
      XmlQualifiedName

      The type name of the annotation.

    • id
      Guid

      The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the annotation.

    • creationTime
      DateTime

      The date and time the annotation was first created.

    • lastModificationTime
      DateTime

      The date and time the annotation was last modified.

    Remarks

    Note

    This constructor is used by the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) serialization infrastructure and should not be used directly under ordinary circumstances.

Properties

  • Anchors

    Gets a collection of zero or more AnnotationResource anchor elements that define the data selection(s) being annotated.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource> Anchors { get; }

    Property Value

    • Collection<AnnotationResource>

      A collection of zero or more AnnotationResource anchor elements.

    Remarks

    Each AnnotationResource in the Anchors collection identifies a data selection to which the annotation is bound (in other words, "the data selection that is being annotated"). While most annotations refer to a single data selection and contain just one anchor AnnotationResource, multiple anchors can occur if a single annotation refers to multiple data selections.

    The returned Anchors collection is never null; however, the collection may contain zero elements.

  • AnnotationType

    Gets the XmlQualifiedName of the annotation type.

    public System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName AnnotationType { get; }

    Property Value

    • XmlQualifiedName

      The XML qualified name for this kind of annotation.

    Remarks

    The returned annotation type is the XmlQualifiedName name passed as a parameter to the Annotation constructor.

    Note

    AnnotationType returns null if the annotation was incorrectly constructed by using a default constructor without parameters. (The default constructor without parameters does not fully initialize the instance and is used only internally in combination with XML serialization.) To create a new annotation, applications should use the Annotation constructor that takes an XmlQualifiedName as a parameter.

  • Authors

    Gets a collection of zero or more author strings that identify who created the Annotation.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<string> Authors { get; }

    Property Value

    • Collection<String>

      A collection of zero or more author strings.

    Remarks

    The returned Authors collection is never null; however, the collection can contain zero elements if no author is specified.

  • Cargos

    Gets a collection of zero or more AnnotationResource cargo elements that contain data for the annotation.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource> Cargos { get; }

    Property Value

    • Collection<AnnotationResource>

      A collection of zero or more AnnotationResource cargo elements.

    Remarks

    Each AnnotationResource in the Cargos collection contains user-defined data for the annotation.

    The returned Cargos collection is never null; however, the collection may contain zero elements if there is no user data for the annotation.

  • CreationTime

    Gets the date and the time that the annotation was created.

    public DateTime CreationTime { get; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      The date and the time the annotation was created.

    Remarks

    Note

    CreationTime returns System.DateTime if the annotation was incorrectly created by using the default Annotation constructor without parameters. An Annotation constructor with parameters should be used to correctly instantiate a new annotation.

  • Id

    Gets the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the Annotation.

    public Guid Id { get; }

    Property Value

    • Guid

      The GUID of the annotation.

    Remarks

    Note

    Id returns Guid if the annotation was instantiated by using the default Annotation constructor without parameters. An Annotation constructor with parameters should be used to correctly instantiate a new annotation with a valid GUID .

  • LastModificationTime

    Gets the date and the time that the annotation was last modified.

    public DateTime LastModificationTime { get; }

    Property Value

    • DateTime

      The date and the time the annotation was last modified.

Methods

  • GetSchema()

    Always returns null. See Annotations Schema for schema details.

    public System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema GetSchema ();

    Returns

    • XmlSchema

      Always null. See Annotations Schema for schema details.

  • ReadXml(XmlReader)

    Deserializes the Annotation from a specified XmlReader.

    public void ReadXml (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);

    Parameters

    • reader
      XmlReader

      The XML reader to use to deserialize the annotation.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      reader is null.

    • XmlException

      The serialized XML for the Annotation is not valid.

  • WriteXml(XmlWriter)

    Serializes the annotation to a specified XmlWriter.

    public void WriteXml (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer);

    Parameters

    • writer
      XmlWriter

      The XML writer to use to serialize the annotation.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      writer is null.

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.AnnotationType* is not valid.

Events

  • AnchorChanged

    Occurs when an anchor is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation stem.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors*.

    public event System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResourceChangedEventHandler AnchorChanged;

    Remarks

    In addition to when an anchor is added or removed, AnchorChanged occurs on any modifications to an anchor subpart, such as a change to a ContentLocatorPart.

  • AuthorChanged

    Occurs when an author is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation stem.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Authors*.

    public event System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationAuthorChangedEventHandler AuthorChanged;
  • CargoChanged

    Occurs when a cargo is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation stem.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos*.

    public event System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResourceChangedEventHandler CargoChanged;

    Remarks

    In addition to when a cargo is added or removed, CargoChanged occurs on any modification to a cargo subpart, such as a change to an XmlElement in the Contents collection of a cargo.
